title: The Local Church is where All this Complexity gets Instantiated for the Individual
description:
Always lots of talk here about theory, etc. It is at the local church, real life decisions and actions where it all comes to be focused on the individual. That was the theme that emerged from this week's questions.

0:00:10  Intro / announcements
0:03:20  How long will Jordan Peterson stay apart from Christ?
0:19:55  What’s the right framework of understanding the spiritual world and our place in it?
0:29:55  Is The Lord used to describe the Trinity or The Father?
0:31:30  Story about missionaries coming to colonize dock workers.
0:34:35  How to get rid of existential anxiety and panic attacks at the prospect of eternal torment after death?
0:50:25  Any tips to get the most of the Book of Romans?
0:56:40  Identity / Meaning Crisis: Is the end of modernity creating space for church or is church bringing the end of modernity? 
1:11:30  What should a young Calvinist do if he falls for a 18 year old blonde secular girl?
1:14:40  How to explain the difference between ‘God in me’ and ‘God in Christ?’
1:16:55  Should we just wait for Christ to come back?
1:24:35  What’re PVK’s thoughts on the discussion between Boyce and Friended? Screed on distinction between OT and NT. 
1:25:20  Why are there three parts in the Trinity and not two (Spirit and Jesus)?
1:30:30  How to improve the situation of anti-Catholic animus among Protestants?
1:34:40  Is there a connection between the words Spirit and Breath?
1:36:40  Will PVK do another converzation with Pageau and Vervaeke together?
1:44:45  Would philosophical and historical arguments help Jordan Peterson?
1:49:10  Why hasn’t the CRC made C.S. Lewis a saint?
1:50:30  Are we in a zombie apocalypse where our animated ancestors are feeding on our brains?
1:51:05  Can you be a Christian and a rock star?
1:52:35  Upcoming YouTube videos in this corner of the internet (incl. The Estuary documentary)
1:53:40  Closing remarks / no Q&A next week / remodeling conference
1:54:45  End of transmission
